body_html: How do you build pytorch? By default it tries to find GPUs on your system and builds for their architectures, if v100 was not visible at the time of build, you will get this error. Alternatively, you can set TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST env variable to include all the archtectures you need, regardless of whether they are visible at compile time.

Alternatively, you can set TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST env variable to include all the archtectures you need, regardless of whether they are visible at compile time.
body: How do you build pytorch? By default it tries to find GPUs on your system and builds for their architectures, if v100 was not visible at the time of build, you will get this error. Alternatively, you can set TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST env variable to include all the archtectures you need, regardless of whether they are visible at compile time.
